meta.@content: Reverse engineer and hopefully elaborate on Pajek visualization structures
An experimental version of X3D JSON encoding is used for this scene.  Status online at http://www.web3d.org/wiki/index.php/X3D_JSON_Encoding

ProtoDeclare.@appinfo: Arc is a network connection between Vertex nodes, displayed using Cylinder/Cone (arrow/arrowhead) geometry with modifiable color and transparency

field.@appinfo: length of Arc between Vertex locations
offset distance for Cone arrowhead; TODO this needs to match values in the Vertex protopye, which is iniitialized separately
debug trace to Browser output console

-children.#comment: First node determines node type of this prototype
TODO these trial values are from Arc 1.6, radius is a candidate parameter

field.@appinfo: length of Arc between Vertex locations
offset distance for Cone arrowhead; TODO this needs to match values in the Vertex protopye, which is iniitialized separately
debug trace to Browser output console

#sourceText: // TODO? potential visualization improvment (at possible cost of breaking simple 1:1 mapping)
// compute Cone translation (and perhaps cone size) based on Cylinder size
// then send result to the Cone parent transform
// conceivably this extended Cylinder length is a feature, not a bug...
// if the Cylinder goes to the center of the ball, then you can turn off both
// balls and Cone arrowheads to yield a simple stick-only model
// so we need to consider this as an animation/visualization feature as well

ProtoDeclare.@appinfo: Vertex is a node, typically connected by zero or more Arc segments, and displayed using Sphere geometry with modifiable color and transparency

-children.#comment: First node determines node type of this prototype
TODO for future work: Billboard for text visibility
TODO do we really want to honor Pajek's default Text family?
Subsequent nodes do not render, but still must be a valid X3D subgraph

ProtoDeclare.@appinfo: Text describing what the Vertices and Arcs are about

field.@appinfo: information to identify the Integral Network
